alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 11:55AM EDT until May 02 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Vail Road in Montville. The Road heading into Parsippany is subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EDT Monday the stage was 5.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM EDT Monday was 5.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.2 feet on 04/02/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (2 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 5.9 Mon 11 a 5.6 5.0 6.2 2pm 5/01 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 1200 AM EDT.
